DOC.brief_summary: The Örebro prevention program is a brief (6 x 30 minutes)program administered to parents of 13-16 year old youths in regular parental meetings. The program aims to encourage parents to maintain a restrictive attitude towards youth drinking throughout their children's teenage years, and thereby postpone and reduce youth drinking. A previous quasi-experimental study by the program developers showed a sustained alcohol-specific restrictivity among parents exposed to the program, and also a reduction on drinking measures among the youths of the exposed parents (Koutakis, Stattin & Kerr, 2008). This study aims to investigate whether these effects are sustained also when the program has gone into wide dissemination in Sweden.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of the Örebro Prevention Program on Youth Drinking
DOC.criteria: Municipal schools in counties with local ÖPP program presenters, comprising grades 79, with at least two 7th grade classes in parallel, and with no previous experience of the Örebro prevention program.
